intro: Cheilanthes jonesii, commonly known as Jones' rockcap, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and dark green, leathery fronds. The plant typically thrives in rocky or crevice habitats, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its rhizomes are short and thick, allowing it to anchor firmly in crevices and retain moisture. Cheilanthes jonesii is well adapted to dry environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
